oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin C. York story -- southside of Jamestown

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drugstores; Automobiles; Department stores; Dry goods stores
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World war, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History; Motion pictures; Jamestown (Tenn.); Alvin C. York Agricultural Institute
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A street on the south side of Jamestown, Tennessee. A number of cars and trucks are parked on the street in front of several shops and businesses. Businesses photographed include International Harvester McCormick-Deering, a dry goods and hardware store, H. C. Cravens' 5-10 Cent Store, and H. C. Cravens & Co. Department Store.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pall Mall in Fentress County was Alvin York's hometown. Photographs were taken during a series of meetings between York and Hollywood producers related to a proposed film based on his World War I exploits. Producers captured images of the meeting between York and Warner Brothers filmmakers as they researched the film, "Sergeant York."
